definition: to do sth when least expected (idiom); to catch sb off guard

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
(negative prefix)/not/no
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate
to catch an enemy off guard with a surprise attack (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
pinyin: chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4

sentences.english: Don't give away your positions until you see the mammoth. He's the one to surprise.
sentences.chinese: 沒見到毛象之前別暴露你們自己，我們得出其不意。

sentences.english: The police crept up from behind and took the gangster by surprise.
sentences.chinese: 警察悄悄從背後繞過去，出其不意地將歹徒逮捕。

sentences.english: The police issued an identikit picture of the mugger.
sentences.chinese: 警察印發出其不意行兇搶劫者的形象拼圖。
他出其不意地使我招認了。

sentences.english: He jabbed me in the body.
sentences.chinese: 他出其不意地撞我的身體。

sentences.english: Vanish roller coaster at Cosmo Land in Japan unexpectedly dives into an underwater tunnel.
sentences.chinese: 日本大世界過山車會出其不意的駛進水下隧道里。

sentences.english: Shiki muses that death is always abrupt.
sentences.chinese: 志貴明白了死亡總是出其不意來臨的。

sentences.english: The police surprised the thief into confessing.
sentences.chinese: 警察出其不意地使小偷招認了。

sentences.english: These approaches often have a smooth unexpected beneficial effect.
sentences.chinese: 這些辦法都能有一些出其不意的好效果。

sentences.english: The truth must be elicited by surprise.
sentences.chinese: 必須出其不意，才能套出真情。

sentences.english: Love is steading a kiss when you stop before at the red light.
sentences.chinese: 愛是，等候紅燈時的一個出其不意的吻。

sentences.english: To take in surprise criticism more productively, we need a game plan.
sentences.chinese: 想要很好的接受出其不意的批評，我們需要一個策略。

sentences.english: Business environments are ever-changing, with problems often popping up unexpectedly.
sentences.chinese: 商業環境一直在變化，出其不意的問題會不斷冒出。

definition: to win by a surprise move
see 出其不意，攻其不備|出其不意，攻其不备[chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4]
to catch an enemy off guard with a surprise attack (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
pinyin: chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4

definition: to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
surprise attack/raid
to mount a sneak attack/to raid
surprise attack
no time to deal with it (idiom); caught unprepared
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
to deliver a frontal assault/to meet head-on (idiom)
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
unexpectedly/unawareness/unpreparedness
see 出其不意，攻其不備|出其不意，攻其不备[chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4]
a blitzkrieg strategy (idiom)/to resolve sth in the shortest time possible/to get sth done quickly
troops appearing suddenly (in a raid or ambush)
